Thanks, however I agree with the other comments. I'm not sure that the additional titles & whitespace are clarifying anything; the existing doc seems pretty clear as is.

Besides clarity...it is easier to copy and paste the command. The change also conforms with the existing indented code block markdown as opposed to the fenced code block markdown.\nIndented code blocks are more portable across markdown interpreters and should probably be a standard practice for markdown in the documentation. Fenced code blocks with syntax highlighting should be avoided all togeth
I think it would have helped to state the motivation in the commit message or pull request description. Sometimes it is hard to see the reasoning from just a diff.

It makes it more confusing, IMO.
What does "For macOS" mean: a host system or a target one?

Let's leave it as is :)
I agree with @hebasto that this is less clear than the way it is currently.
